ygData.subject: FW: [eqpaladin] Archery training
ygData.msgSnippet: Unfortunately, we [paladins] can t equip the tiny dagger or the pine needle which is what is normally used to advance your archery.  I simply sunk 25 skill
ygData.messageBody:
Unfortunately, we [paladins] can't equip the tiny dagger or the pine needle
which is what is normally used to advance your archery. I simply sunk 25
skill points into it. This is a decent level to start your skill at and
it's actually raised up 4 points with about 75 arrows (7.5 gold worth). Not
too bad a trade off, but keep in mind that you have to hit
blue/white/yellow/red things in order to get results (I was hitting a lot of
green things at first and that 75 arrows is counting that so your results
may vary)


-Bamphir of Tarrew Marr

-----Original Message-----
From: Gary Long [SMTP:glong@...]
<mailto:[SMTP:glong@...]>
Sent: Wednesday, June 02, 1999 11:30 AM
To: eqpaladin@onelist.com <mailto:eqpaladin@onelist.com>
Subject: [eqpaladin] Archery training
From: Gary Long <glong@...
<mailto:glong@...> >

Hail fellow Paladins,

I was wondering how all of you were faring with archery skill advancement?
At 10th level, sinking 1 training point into archery, then using 20 arrows
with a cheap hunting bow I have yet to see my skill increase. I purchased a
tiny dagger from a friendly enchanter, but found that I can't equip it. My
next thought is to either purchase a lot of arrows (100) and use the bow as
much as possible or to "jump start" the archery skill by putting 5 more
training points into it. Any feedback or opinions?
Kaladin, the 'range 50' Paladin
--
